name: The radical power of the glitch
description: Brian Eno said, “Whatever you now find weird, ugly, uncomfortable and nasty about a new medium will surely become its signature.” Videogame glitches can seem annoying or obstructive – but for the artists in Out of Bounds, they offer radical creative potential.

key_work.title: Out of Bounds
key_work.brief_description:
Out of Bounds follows a group of Melbourne-based artists (Goldie Bartlett, Andrew Brophy, Ian MacLarty and Kalonica Quigley) known as The Grannies as they break ‘out of bounds’ in Rockstar Games’ hit action-adventure videogame Red Dead Redemption 2, travelling beyond the authored limits of the game’s virtual world and into the increasingly broken and abstract space beyond. Rather than being driven by the desire to dominate or ‘win’, their adventures are driven by creative curiosity, presenting play as not just an end in itself, but as a form of artistic practice.

Through a multichannel video artwork titled The Grannies (dir. Marie Foulston), which is narrated by The Grannies themselves, plus an original artistic videogame and stunning stills, Out of Bounds: Exploring the Limits of Videogames asks what exists beyond the border of the digital worlds we inhabit.

The Grannies is accompanied by an original experimental videogame by Ian MacLarty called Red Desert Render, which seeks to recreate the feeling of curiosity and community that The Grannies themselves felt during their adventures out of bounds, and previously unseen images from the artists’ other adventures beyond the map.

Out of Bounds offers a rare glimpse into the cracks of the apparent seamlessness of the digital world through an artist’s eyes.

We live in a digital world. Bouncing between email, apps, video conferences,
social media and videogames, our lives are channeled through highly curated
virtual realms, each designed towards set goals and particular tasks.
But what happens if we don’t play by the rules?
Using screen-captured footage and stills from Red Dead Redemption 2,
Out of Bounds follows the adventures of a group of Melbourne-based artists
as they break ‘out of bounds’ in Rockstar Games’ hit action-adventure
videogame. While documenting the game’s pristine environments, they
pushed past the limits of the map, stumbling into an automatically generated
space players aren’t meant to access.
In The Grannies, a multi-channel video artwork inside the gallery, we view
their adventures through an increasingly broken, abstract digital landscape.
Accompanying this installation is Ian MacLarty’s original experimental
videogame Red Desert Render, which recreates the curiosity and community
that the players felt during their time together.
Out of Bounds reveals the materiality of the digital spaces we inhabit,
offering a rare glimpse into the cracks through the eyes of artists

constellations_primary.name: The radical power of the glitch
constellations_primary.description: Brian Eno said, “Whatever you now find weird, ugly, uncomfortable and nasty about a new medium will surely become its signature.” Videogame glitches can seem annoying or obstructive – but for the artists in Out of Bounds, they offer radical creative potential.

start.title: Ben Drowned

video_links.name: Ben Drowned - The Full Story & ARG

start.brief_description: Ben Drowned is a web serial created by Alexander D. “Jadusable” Hall. in 2010. Originally presented as a series of real events, the narrative describes Jadusable purchasing a cartridge of Legend of Zelda: Majora’s Mask (2000) only to discover it is haunted by a malevolent spirit.

constellations_other.name: The radical power of the glitch
constellations_other.description: Brian Eno said, “Whatever you now find weird, ugly, uncomfortable and nasty about a new medium will surely become its signature.” Videogame glitches can seem annoying or obstructive – but for the artists in Out of Bounds, they offer radical creative potential.

recommendations.quote: Ben Drowned is a web serial created by Alexander D. "Jadusable" Hall. in 2010. Originally presented as a series of real events, the narrative describes Jadusable purchasing a cartridge of Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask only to discover it is haunted by a malevolent spirit.

end.title: Inscryption
end.brief_description: Inscryption is an inky black card-based odyssey that blends the deckbuilding roguelike, escape-room style puzzles, and psychological horror into a blood-laced smoothie. Darker still are the secrets inscrybed upon the cards…

constellations_other.name: The radical power of the glitch
constellations_other.description: Brian Eno said, “Whatever you now find weird, ugly, uncomfortable and nasty about a new medium will surely become its signature.” Videogame glitches can seem annoying or obstructive – but for the artists in Out of Bounds, they offer radical creative potential.

links.description: Commercial videogames sometimes use glitch aesthetics for narrative purposes. Inspired by posts like Ben Drowned, Inscryption (2021) sets the player up to expect a straightforward card game – expectations which are subverted through purposeful “glitches” that reveal a larger, darker story.

start.title: Inscryption
start.brief_description: Inscryption is an inky black card-based odyssey that blends the deckbuilding roguelike, escape-room style puzzles, and psychological horror into a blood-laced smoothie. Darker still are the secrets inscrybed upon the cards…

constellations_other.name: The radical power of the glitch
constellations_other.description: Brian Eno said, “Whatever you now find weird, ugly, uncomfortable and nasty about a new medium will surely become its signature.” Videogame glitches can seem annoying or obstructive – but for the artists in Out of Bounds, they offer radical creative potential.

end.title: Jpegs
end.brief_description: In his series Jpegs (2004), photographer Thomas Ruff printed downloaded images at massive scale, allowing the blown out pixels to distort and warp the original images. This series calls attention to the materiality of the digital artefacts we create, consume and share everyday.

constellations_other.name: The radical power of the glitch
constellations_other.description: Brian Eno said, “Whatever you now find weird, ugly, uncomfortable and nasty about a new medium will surely become its signature.” Videogame glitches can seem annoying or obstructive – but for the artists in Out of Bounds, they offer radical creative potential.

links.description: Other artists use glitch to explore the limits of their practice. In photographer Thomas Ruff’s series Jpegs (2004), he prints compressed files at huge scale, distorting the images beyond recognition. This draws attention to the materiality of the digital images we view and share every day.

start.title: Jpegs
start.brief_description: In his series Jpegs (2004), photographer Thomas Ruff printed downloaded images at massive scale, allowing the blown out pixels to distort and warp the original images. This series calls attention to the materiality of the digital artefacts we create, consume and share everyday.

constellations_other.name: The radical power of the glitch
constellations_other.description: Brian Eno said, “Whatever you now find weird, ugly, uncomfortable and nasty about a new medium will surely become its signature.” Videogame glitches can seem annoying or obstructive – but for the artists in Out of Bounds, they offer radical creative potential.

end.title: Glitch Feminism
end.brief_description: Legacy Russell’s Glitch Feminism (2020) reclaims the socio-cultural dimensions of the glitch, considering it as an tool for artistic emancipation in a digital culture that consumes our images voraciously.

constellations_other.name: The radical power of the glitch
constellations_other.description: Brian Eno said, “Whatever you now find weird, ugly, uncomfortable and nasty about a new medium will surely become its signature.” Videogame glitches can seem annoying or obstructive – but for the artists in Out of Bounds, they offer radical creative potential.

recommendations.quote: Legacy Russell's Glitch Feminism (2020) reclaims the socio-cultural dimensions of the glitch, considering it as an tool for artistic emancipation in a digital culture where our images are voraciously consumed.

links.description: Like Thomas Ruff, curator Legacy Russell is interested in the materiality that glitches reveal in digital artefacts - and in their subversive power. In her manifesto Glitch Feminism (2020), Russell considers the emancipatory power of the glitch in a digital culture driven by a voracious appetite for our images.

constellations_primary.name: The radical power of the glitch
constellations_primary.description: Brian Eno said, “Whatever you now find weird, ugly, uncomfortable and nasty about a new medium will surely become its signature.” Videogame glitches can seem annoying or obstructive – but for the artists in Out of Bounds, they offer radical creative potential.

end.title: Red Dead Redemption 2
end.brief_description: Developed by the creators of Grand Theft Auto V and Red Dead Redemption, Red Dead Redemption 2 is an epic tale of life in America’s unforgiving heartland. The game’s vast and atmospheric world will also provide the foundation for a brand new online multiplayer experience.

constellations_other.name: The radical power of the glitch
constellations_other.description: Brian Eno said, “Whatever you now find weird, ugly, uncomfortable and nasty about a new medium will surely become its signature.” Videogame glitches can seem annoying or obstructive – but for the artists in Out of Bounds, they offer radical creative potential.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

links.description: Out of Bounds is part of an online culture celebrating the bugs, glitches and hidden areas in videogames. Youtuber Boundary Break built a career on revealing the hidden areas in videogames that players are never meant to see, including a video on Red Dead Redemption 2 (2018).

start.title: Red Dead Redemption 2

Originally presented as a series of real events, the narrative describes Jadusable purchasing a cartridge of Legend of Zelda: Majora’s Mask (2000) only to discover it is haunted by a malevolent spirit.

recommendations.quote: Ben Drowned is a web serial created by Alexander D. "Jadusable" Hall. in 2010. Originally presented as a series of real events, the narrative describes Jadusable purchasing a cartridge of Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask only to discover it is haunted by a malevolent spirit.

links.description: Glitches take on a mythological dimension. In 2010, Reddit user Jadusable created Ben Drowned, a series of posts in which he described buying a haunted second-hand cartridge of Legend of Zelda: Majora’s Mask (2000). The malevolent ghost reveals himself through scary glitches.
